rdf:Description.rdfs:label: uses communication protocol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a system and the communication protocol it uses.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Geometry
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the shape of the light emission. It might be instantiated by individuals like "spherical", "cylindrical", etc. even though it is open to more comples representation of geometries using other vocabularies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has transmission period
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The relation between a device and the period in which it transmit information.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the value of a certain property, e.g., energy or power

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is projected from height
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a light and the height measurement from which it is projected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has flash
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship stating whether a light has flash.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Color
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Color of the emitted light. It might be indicated by named colors or using other type of color values like hexadecimal for RGB, color temperature, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is accesible through
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The relation between a digital representation and the service which it is accesible through.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Frequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the property frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is connected to
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a system and the system to which it is connected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. A device that has category saref:Sensor and performs a saref:SensingFunction.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: measures property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a sensor and the property o properties it can take measurement about.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: relates to property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a measurement and the property such measurement is about.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Unit of measure
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Luminiscence
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property luminiscence.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: affects property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between an actuator with the property or properties it can act on

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has shield
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship stating whether a lamppost has a shield.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: encapsulates
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a digital representation and the physical objects it represents.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Photometer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A photometer, generally, is an instrument that measures light intensity or optical properties of solutions or surfaces.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Height
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the property height.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Point
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84. Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e. spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT), at(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT). sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Communication interface
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An interface defines which primitive operations and services the lower layer makes available to the upper one, when referring to network layers. (Definition adapted from "Tanenbaum, A. S. (2003). Computer networks, 4-th edition. ed: Prentice Hall.")

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is projected in direction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a light and the direction in which it is projected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Phosphorescence
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property phosphorescence.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: location
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The relation between something and the point, or other geometrical thing in space, where it is. For example, the realtionship between a radio tower and a Point with a given lat and long. Or a relationship between a park and its outline as a closed arc of points, or a road and its location as a arc (a sequence of points). Clearly in practice there will be limit to the accuracy of any such statement, but one would expect an accuracy appropriate for the size of the object and uses such as mapping .

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Service
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service, the function(s) to be represented, and the (input and output) parameters necessary to operate the service.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: projects light
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a lamppost or a light point and the light (or lights) they might project.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Period
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the property period.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Illuminance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property illuminance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Height measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value made over a height property. It is also linked to the height unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: makes measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a sensor and the measurements it makes. Such measurement will link together the valur of the measurement, its unit of measure and the property to which it relates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Fluorescence
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property fluorescence.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship providing a description of an entity (e.g., device)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Light point
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An spatial point from where a light is projected. It might belong to a lamppost.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship providing the name of an entity (e.g., device)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TESS (Telescope Encoder and Sky Sensor)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Telescope Encoder and Sky Sensor (TESS) is a Sky Brightness and Cloud detector developed as a device for a remote observatory. A TESS can observe the light magnitude and other properties as ambient temperature and sky temperature.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has manufacturer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Reflection of light
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property reflection of light.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has version
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the version of a certain entity (e.g., a device)
A protocol is an agreement between the communicating parties on how communication is to proceed. (Definition taken from "Tanenbaum, A. S. (2003). Computer networks, 4-th edition. ed: Prentice Hall.")
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Communication protocol
Length unit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unit of measure for the quantity lenght.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device that makes measurements of particular properties of a area of interes. For example, the light luminiscence.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Scattering of light
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property scattering of light.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lamppost
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A tall pole with a light at the top.

The four cardinal directions or cardinal points are the directions of north, east, south, and west, commonly denoted by their initials: N, E, S, W. East and west are at right angles to north and south, with east being in the clockwise direction of rotation from north and west being directly opposite east. Intermediate points between the four cardinal directions form the points of the compass. (definition taken from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardinal_direction)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Compass direction
has color
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a light emitted and its color.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Frequency measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value made over a frequency property. It is also linked to the frequency unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Period measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value over a period property. It is also linked to the period unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has geometry
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a light emitted and the shape it is projected in.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Light magnitude
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property light magnitude.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has light point
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a lamppost and its light points

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has creation date
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the creation date of an entity (e.g., a digital representation).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Light property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An aspect of light that can be observable by a sensor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is component of
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a system and the system it belongs to as a component.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Digital representation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital representation encapsulates a physical object accessible via Web services

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: uses communication interface
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a system and the communication interface it uses.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has tag
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship stating the tags that can be assigned to an entity (e.g., a digital representation).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has revision number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the revision number of a certain entity (e.g., a device)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: contains
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a physical object and the physical objects that can be contained in it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Irradiance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property irradiance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is contained in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a physical object and the physical object in which it might be contained.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has identifier
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship providing the identifier of an entity (e.g., digital representation)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has frequency measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The relation between a device and the frequency in which it makes measurements.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Physical object
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any Object that has a proper space region. (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has digital representation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a physical object and the digital representation in which it is encapsulated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Light absorption
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the light property light absorption.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Frequency unit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unit of measure for the quantity frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has component
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a system and the system in which it might be decomposed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Spatial thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position. e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.
is measured in
A relation between a measurement and the unit of measure in which the measurement value is expressed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Temporal unit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A temporal unit of measure, which provides a scale factor for a time quantity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: System
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A group of related hardware units or programs or both, especially when dedicated to a single application. (Definition taken from https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/system)

A light source, which may be a lantern, a street light, a floodlight, a signal lamp or any other device whose primary purpose is the generation of light. (Definition taken from http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/Key:light_source#Description)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Light
Measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment. For example a measuring device (definition taken from https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/device). In this ontology it refers to the devices for environmental purposes.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device
Actuator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device that can act over at least one property.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has timestamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship stating the timestamp of an entity (e.g. a measurement).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has projection angle
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the projection angle of an entity (e.g., a light).

rdf:Description.dc:title: SAREF extension for environment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This ontology extends the SAREF ontology for the environment domain, specifically for the light pollution domain, including concepts like photometers, light, etc.
